description: On March 15th 2020, the Peruvian government announced an "obligatory social isolation" (Lockdown) for all citizens/residents. They can only leave their homes for eight main reasons, related to the production and purchase of groceries; pharmaceutical products and first necessity goods; health-related visits to health centres; return to main residence; assistance and care of elderly, children, adolescents and handicapped or vulnerable people; media (journalists) and call centers; fuel (distribution and purchase); and providing and using financial services (e.g. banks).

description: The Government of Peru announced the mandatory social lockdown of people in their homes from April 13th to April 26th, 2020 during the extension of the State of National Emergency all day on Sundays. Additionally, only one person per family unit is permitted to travel Monday through Saturday for necessities such as food, pharmaceutical products, and financial procedures.

During the State of National Emergency in Peru that has been extended from May 11th, 2020 to May 24th, 2020, people in risk groups for COVID-19 must stay in their homes for lockdown except for urgent medical care, emergencies and food and medicine, only if they do not have a support person for this. Additionally, they may leave to collect a government benefit, pension, or to work as long as they assume responsibility voluntarily. The people in risk groups include people over sixty-five (65) years of age and those with comorbidities such as high blood pressure, diabetes, cardiovascular diseases, chronic lung disease, cancer, and others.
